  <h3>How do I create a new Code Chunk? </h3>
  <h4>&emsp; Syntax </h4>
  <p> 
     &emsp;&emsp;&#96;&#96;&#96; {r <i>code-chunk-label</i>}<br>&emsp;
     &emsp;&emsp;#your code here
     <br>&emsp;&emsp;&#96;&#96;&#96;
  </p>
  <p>
    &emsp;&emsp; <b>Replace</b> <i>code-chunk-label</i> with what you want to label that code chunk
  </p>
  
  <h3>How do I create a new Title/Header?</h3>
  
  <!-- New Section -->
  <h4>Notes on Headers and Comments</h4>
  <ul>
    <li>
    When used on the yellow background, the <code>#</code> symbol creates titles and headers that show up in large font in the output document. 
    </li>
    <li>
    We use text such as <code>## Exercises</code> and <code>### Exercise1</code> to label exercises as first and second level headers. 
    </li>
    <li>
      However, when used inside a code chunk, the <code>#</code>            symbol in R creates a code <em>comment</em>. This can be used to        write regular text inside a code chunk. 
    </li>
    <li>
      Any text written in a code chunk after the <code>#</code> symbol         is ignored; it is not run as R code.
    </li>
  </ul>
